Message.MsgText: WVER0225E=WVER0225E: No value was specified for the ''{0}'' argument.
Message.Explanation: The listed argument requires a value. Use the -help or -usage argument to display the usage information.
Message.UserResponse: Specify a value for the listed argument.

Message.MsgText: WVER0264E=WVER0264E: Unable to record the removal of the application of fix {0} on component {1} -- no application is on record.
Message.Explanation: The component cannot find a record of an application for the specified fix. The product information might be corrupted or an internal error might have occurred.
Message.UserResponse: If the problem persists, additional information might be available if you search for the message ID on the following Web sites: WebSphere Application Server Support page: http://www.ibm.com/software/webservers/appserv/was/support/ WebSphere Application Server for z/OS Support page: http://www.ibm.com/software/webservers/appserv/zos_os390/support/ .

Message.MsgText: WVER0205E=WVER0205E: An exception occurred while creating a backup for history file {0} to {1}
Message.Explanation: The Application Server cannot create backup files for the history files.
Message.UserResponse: For more information, see the nested or associated error messages.

Message.MsgText: WVER0263E=WVER0263E: Unable to record the removal of the application of fix {0} on component {1} stored in file {2}.
Message.Explanation: The Application Server cannot remove the specified file.
Message.UserResponse: Verify that the Application Server can remove the specified file.

Message.MsgText: WVER0269E=WVER0269E: Unable to record the removal of the application of maintenance package {0} on component {1} -- no application is on record.
Message.Explanation: The component does not have a record of applying the specified maintenance package. The product information might be corrupted or an internal error might have occurred.
Message.UserResponse: If the problem persists, additional information might be available if you search for the message ID on the following Web sites: WebSphere Application Server Support page: http://www.ibm.com/software/webservers/appserv/was/support/ WebSphere Application Server for z/OS Support page: http://www.ibm.com/software/webservers/appserv/zos_os390/support/ .

Message.MsgText: WVER0204E=WVER0204E: An exception occurred while creating the history directory {0}
Message.Explanation: The Application Server cannot create the history directory.
Message.UserResponse: For more information, see the nested or associated error messages.

Message.MsgText: WVER0243E=WVER0243E: Exceptions occurred while processing history information.
Message.Explanation: The Application Server cannot process the history information.
Message.UserResponse: For more information, see the nested or associated error messages.

Message.MsgText: WVER0272E=WVER0272E: An exception occurred while reading {0}
Message.Explanation: he Application Server cannot read the file.
Message.UserResponse: For more information, see the nested or associated error messages.

Message.MsgText: WVER0262E=WVER0262E: Unable to record the removal of the application of fix {0} on component {1} in file {2}.
Message.Explanation: The Application Server cannot save the specified file.
Message.UserResponse: Verify that Application Server can write to the specified file. Also, verify that space is available for a new file.

Message.MsgText: WVER0268E=WVER0268E: Unable to record the removal of the application of maintenance package {0} on component {1} stored in file {2}. The named file could not be removed. Or the Named file could not be created
Message.Explanation: The Application Server cannot create or remove the specified file.
Message.UserResponse: Verify that Application Server can write to or remove the specified file. Also, verify that space is available for a new file if applicable.

Message.MsgText: WVER0203E=WVER0203E: An exception occurred while reading {0}
Message.Explanation: The Application Server cannot read the file.
Message.UserResponse: For more information, see the nested or associated error messages.

Message.MsgText: WVER0242E=WVER0242E: An exception occurred while processing history information.
Message.Explanation: The Application Server cannot process the history information.
Message.UserResponse: For more information, see the nested or associated error messages.

Message.MsgText: WVER0271E=WVER0271E: Unrecognized product history file extension ''{0}''.
Message.Explanation: The history information is stored in files that have specific file name extensions. The extension names determine the type of information that is stored in each file. Valid extension names are .ptfDriver, and .ptfApplied. An attempt has been made to load a file that contains version information. However, the file name extension is not one of the valid extension names.
Message.UserResponse: If the problem persists, additional information might be available if you search for the message ID on the following Web sites: WebSphere Application Server Support page: http://www.ibm.com/software/webservers/appserv/was/support/ WebSphere Application Server for z/OS Support page: http://www.ibm.com/software/webservers/appserv/zos_os390/support/ .

Message.MsgText: WVER0212I=WVER0212I: HistoryInfo Reporter Version {0}, Dated {1}
Message.Explanation: This statement is a standard module description statement.
Message.UserResponse: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: WVER0228E=WVER0228E: The argument ''{0}'' is not a valid argument.
Message.Explanation: The specified argument is not valid. Use the -help or -usage argument to display the usage information.
Message.UserResponse: Change the argument to a valid argument.

Message.MsgText: WVER0261E=WVER0261E: Unable to record the application of fix {0} on component {1} in file {2}.
Message.Explanation: The Application Server cannot save the specified file.
Message.UserResponse: Verify that Application Server can write to the specified file. Also, verify that space is available for a new file.

Message.MsgText: WVER0267E=WVER0267E: Unable to record the removal of the application of maintenance package {0} on component {1} in file {2}.
Message.Explanation: The Application Server cannot save the specified file.
Message.UserResponse: Verify that Application Server can write to the specified file. Also, verify that space is available for a new file.

Message.MsgText: WVER0202E=WVER0202E: Unable to load the history information from the history file: {0}.
Message.Explanation: The Application Server cannot load the history information from the history file.
Message.UserResponse: Verify that the Application Server can read the history file. Also, verify that the file uses the correct format.

Message.MsgText: WVER0241E=WVER0241E: Error writing history report to {0}. The text of the error cannot be displayed, but is of type {1}. A second error, of type {2}, occurred while retrieving the error text.
Message.Explanation: The Application Server cannot write the history report to the specified file. When the Application Server attempted to retrieve the text of the second error, another exception occurred.
Message.UserResponse: If the problem persists, additional information might be available if you search for the message ID on the following Web sites: WebSphere Application Server Support page: http://www.ibm.com/software/webservers/appserv/was/support/ WebSphere Application Server for z/OS Support page: http://www.ibm.com/software/webservers/appserv/zos_os390/support/ .

Message.MsgText: WVER0231I=WVER0231I: -format This option specifies the output format of either ''text'' or ''html.''. -file This option specifies the output file and provide a file name. -offeringId This option specifies the offering ID that restricts the events displayed. -maintenancePackageId This option is deprecated and equivalent to using -offeringID. -component This option is deprecated and performs no action. -help This option causes help text to be displayed. -usage This option causes this usage text to be displayed.
Message.Explanation: The message describes the valid arguments to the historyInfo utility program.
Message.UserResponse: No action is required. The usage information message displays upon request.

Message.MsgText: WVER0270E=WVER0270E: Unable to remove maintenance package driver {0} stored in file {2}.
Message.Explanation: The Application Server cannot remove the specified file.
Message.UserResponse: Verify that the Application Server can remove the target file.

Message.MsgText: WVER0201E=WVER0201E: Unable to determine the history directory; the product directory could not be determined
Message.Explanation: The history directory is a subdirectory of the product directory. The Application Server cannot determine the history directory location.
Message.UserResponse: For more information, see the associated version error.

Message.MsgText: WVER0266E=WVER0266E: Recoverable errors occurred while parsing maintenance package driver information.
Message.Explanation: The Application Server cannot parse the maintenance package information and several errors occurred.
Message.UserResponse: For more information, see the nested or associated error messages.

Message.MsgText: WVER0240E=WVER0240E: Error writing version report to {0}: {1}
Message.Explanation: The Application Server cannot write the history report to the specified file.
Message.UserResponse: Verify that the Application Server can write to the specified file. Also verify that sufficient space is available for the report.

Message.MsgText: WVER0230I=WVER0230I: Usage: historyInfo ( [ -format <text | html> ] [ -file <output file> ] [ -offeringId <offeringId> | -maintenancePackageId <maintenancePackageId> ] [ -component <componentName> ] ) | ( [ -help | -? | /help | /? | -usage ] )
Message.Explanation: This informational message describes the arguments for the historyInfo utility program. The historyInfo utility program accepts the following optional keyword arguments: An argument that specifies the output format An argument that specifies an output file An argument that displays the events that are associated with a specified offering only (-maintenancePackageId is deprecated) An argument that is deprecated An argument that displays usage information Use the -usage or -help argument to display additional information.
Message.UserResponse: No action is required. The usage information message displays upon request.

Message.MsgText: WVER0210I=WVER0210I: Copyright (c) IBM Corporation 2002, 2012; All rights reserved.
Message.Explanation: This statement is a standard copyright statement.
Message.UserResponse: No action is required.

Message.MsgText: WVER0226E=WVER0226E: The value ''{0}'' is not a valid format value.
Message.Explanation: The valid format values are text and html. The specified value is not in a valid format. Use the -help or -usage argument to display the usage information.
Message.UserResponse: Change the format value to either text or html.

Message.MsgText: WVER0265E=WVER0265E: Unable to remove fix driver {0} stored in file {2}.
Message.Explanation: The Application Server cannot remove the specified file.
Message.UserResponse: Verify that the Application Server can remove the target file.

Message.MsgText: WVER0206E=WVER0206E: An exception occurred while writing event history {0}
Message.Explanation: The Application Server cannot write the event history file.
Message.UserResponse: For more information, see the nested or associated error messages.
